title: Figma Unveils AI-Powered Erase Object, Isolate Object, and Expand Image Tools in New Editing Toolbar

paragraphs.content: Figma has launched three new AI image editing tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—designed to enable precise edits directly within the platform. These features integrate into a contextual toolbar alongside existing tools like Remove background and Crop, reducing the need to switch to external editors such as Photoshop. Available immediately in Figma Design and Figma Draw for Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plan users with AI enabled, the tools address common workflow frustrations in UI and marketing design.

paragraphs.content: The toolbar centralizes image editing for faster access to actions like object selection, background adjustments, and text overlays. Figma plans to expand these capabilities to additional products next year, further streamlining multi-tool workflows. Early demonstrations highlight practical uses, such as adapting hero images for different aspect ratios without distortion.

sections.title: Breakdown of Erase Object, Isolate Object, and Expand Image Capabilities

paragraphs.content: **Erase object** allows users to lasso and remove specific elements from images while preserving the surrounding background's color, lighting, and texture. **Isolate object** extracts selected subjects for repositioning or styling adjustments, including lighting, shadows, color, or focus changes, making it suitable for product shots or UI mockups. These tools build on an upgraded lasso for more precise selections, enabling edits without affecting the overall image integrity.

primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

paragraphs.content: **Expand image** extends backgrounds to new aspect ratios, such as converting a 1:1 asset into a web banner, without introducing distortion or losing context. This is particularly useful for resizing hero images across desktop, mobile, and social media formats. The features join prompt-based editing via text, enhancing control over AI-generated outputs.

sections.title: Hands-On Performance and Real-World Workflow Testing

paragraphs.content: Independent reviews praise the tools for handling routine tasks like object removal and image extension effectively, often eliminating exports to Photoshop for simple fixes. Demonstrations show strong results on portraits and product photos, with the toolbar making background removal more prominent due to its high usage. However, testers note the upgraded lasso maintains stability in colors and textures during edits.

Figma positions these updates as closing loops on time-consuming processes, with rollout tied to paid plans and future platform-wide availability. Community feedback emphasizes productivity gains for small teams by reducing asset versioning issues. Observers anticipate tighter integrations, such as potential ChatGPT compatibility, to evolve Figma's ecosystem further.
